Everything is super close to this home ... We also recommend the Sunset cruise which has amazing dolphins swimming in front of and around the boat most all of the time. review_text: Very nice, charming, spic-and-span cottage located in a laid-back residential area within the historical district (I believe) of Punta Gorda and within easy walking distance of those restaurants and waterfront areas. My stay was for two nights. The neighborhood is completely safe; I had no qualms about leaving my laptop/ipad in the cottage when going out to eat or walk. The cottage itself is situated behind the main house, making it relatively secluded among palm trees and tropical plants. The inside of the cottage is basically one large L-shaped room with sliding glass doors opening to a small private deck off the back. The kitchen had all the amenities, including a bulletin board containing some nice-to-know information and some complimentary fresh fruit in a bowl on the table and some chilled water in the fridge. The air conditioning worked fine and I left it on one setting as per Ninette's recommendations; there were at least two ceiling fans, one large fan directly over the bed that I occasionally used; all in all, the temperature remained quite comfortable. The immaculate bathroom with shower (strong water pressure) was very nice. There was a nice large wall-mounted TV in direct view of the very comfortable queen bed (with lots of pillows) that worked fine. The place was completely quiet and serene, quite nice to get some computer work done--with not a hint of outside noise including street traffic, which was minimal anyway as I noticed when walking in the neighborhood. There was a grassy parking area for my car to the immediate side of the cottage, so no need to park on the street. Overall I was very satisfied with the accommodations and would stay there again.

review_text:
The Charming Cottage lives up to its name in every conceivable way. It's a charming cottage, on a particularly charming, relentlessly tropical site that is walking distance to the harbor and downtown Punta Gorda - a place that ranks for charm right up there with my other favorite small cities in Florida, St. Augustine and Fernandina Beach (I know - Key West. But Key West is in a class by itself.)
While the outside of Charming Cottage is vintage Old Florida, the inside has been spotlessly updated. On the functional side, my wife and I especially appreciated the comfortable bed; the fast Internet access; and the fully equipped kitchen, with its new, full-sized stove and refrigerator, huge assortment of knives, serving spoons, spatulas and whatnot, three cutting boards of varying sizes, and even a grater. On the aesthetic side, we were equally pleased with the tasteful furnishings and wall art, the large flat-panel TV, and the private deck off the bedroom area.
Speaking of privacy, Charming Cottage will be especially appreciated by travelers who value theirs. It is set back behind the main house, well off the road. We never met our hostess in person, but we did not need to. Her AirBnB text messages combined with instructions posted to a bulletin board in the kitchen told us everything we needed to know to have an enjoyable stay.
If I could change one thing about Charming Cottage, it would be the speed limit on the otherwise beautiful street in the historic district on which it is sited. The street is one way with signs that ask motorists politely to be aware of cyclists and pedestrians but give no hint of the speed they should. Given no hint, most motorists seem to choose about 45. This is not an issue at all in the cottage because of its setback well off the street behind the main house, but the whizzing by is a bit of an annoyance when you're walking your dog along the sidewalk. If I were mayor of Punta Gorda, my first act would be to make that street two-way again and post the speed limit as a "strictly enforced' 25 mph. No doubt commuters from the more suburban neighborhoods who use that route would vote me out after one term. But it would be worth it.
